author: @gregorcampbell2452
text: For anyone trying to sort out the conda_auto_env() function in .zsh (and with a newer version of Conda): -------------------- function conda_auto_env() {   if [ -e "environment.yaml" ]; then     ENV_NAME=$(head -n 1 environment.yaml | cut -f2 -d ' ')     # Check if you are already in the environment     if [[ $CONDA_PREFIX != *$ENV_NAME* ]]; then       # Try to activate environment       conda activate $ENV_NAME &>/dev/null     fi   fi }  precmd_functions+=(conda_auto_env)  -------------- Add this code to ~/.zshrc Hope this helps
